title: Strong Rule of Law
description: In 2023, Ghana had 16 sources confirming its strong rule of law, indicating a robust legal framework and enforcement mechanisms.

title: Efficient Labor Regulations
description: Ghana's labor regulations and public services were highly efficient in 2024, scoring 91.08 in operational efficiency, one of the highest globally.

title: Quality Business Location Regulations
description: In 2024, Ghana scored 87.58 for its quality of regulations for business locations, making it a favorable environment for businesses.

title: Significant Social Safety Net Benefits
description: In 2016, 57.56% of Ghana's social safety net benefits were directed towards the poorest quintile, showcasing a strong focus on social equity.

title: High Voice and Accountability
description: With 14 sources in 2023, Ghana demonstrated a high level of voice and accountability, reflecting a vibrant democratic environment.

title: Low Other Taxes as Percentage of Revenue
description: In 2022, Ghana had a negative percentage of -4.26% for other taxes as a share of revenue, indicating a potential area for fiscal improvement.

title: Negative Other Taxes in Local Currency
description: Ghana recorded a negative value of -4.12 billion in other taxes in 2022, suggesting challenges in tax collection or fiscal policy.

title: Moderate Business Entry Score
description: In 2024, Ghana's business entry score was 40.99, indicating room for improvement in facilitating new business ventures.
